results.brief_description: Teachers from Asumption College, Kilmore, and Nunawading High School are shown putting into practice the “Eclair” approach to the teaching of the French language.

results.title: Taking it in stride: positive approaches to stress management
results.brief_description: Life has a way of getting more and more hectic as time goes by. For many of us, it is a major accomplishment to simply get through the day. This film offers hope by going beyond an analysis of the ‘Stress Response’ and its link to disease. It focuses on solutions, skills for coping with stress.

results.title: Taking chances
results.creator_credit: Ann Darrouzet, Janina Craig Screen Services, Community Services Victoria, Australian Bicentennial Authority, Film Victoria and David Taft
results.brief_description: Discusses recreation and leisure options for intellectually disabled poeple and the benefits to organisers, participants and parents. Profiles intellectually disabled people participating in an aquabuddy program, competitive darts, basketball, radio broadcasting and gardening. Emphasises a focus on ability rather than disability.

results.title: Taking care of yourself: breast self-examination
results.creator_credit: Instant Replay Productions, Westmead Hospital and New South Wales Cancer Council
results.brief_description: Most women take care of their bodies, however very few of them check their breasts as often as they should. This program explains the importance of regular breast self-examination, and provides a step-by-step guide for carrying out effective examinations. It also provides guidelines on what to look out for when carrying out breast self-examination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Instant Replay Productions, Westmead Hospital and New South Wales Cancer Council

results.title: Taking care of your pets
results.brief_description: An appeal to all animal lovers to assist with the humane work of caring for our sick and injured animal population. Illustrates the medical attention provided at the Dogs’ Home and Hospital; the work of ambulances treating animals injured by modern high-speed traffic; the work of the dog catchers collecting stray animals from the streets and the subsequent care of these at the Dogs’ Home.

results.title: Taking blood pressure
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and Chicago Film Laboratory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Shows how to use blood pressure equipment, how to locate an artery, and other matters connected with the obtaining of a blood pressure reading.

results.title: Taking action
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and James Mann
results.brief_description: This video has been prepared to assist and challenge people in positions of responsibility in schools to provide active and supportive leadership to staff by identifying issues of concern; creating openings for discussion; and taking action in creative, caring and supportive ways. Presents three case studies showing typical school situations in which work performance and organisational issues affect staff relations.

results.title: Taking a time study
results.creator_credit: Gerald Cookson, Kinocraft and Stephen Clarkson
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic techniques for taking a time study. The method illustrated has been agreed upon by the representatives of management and trade unions and is recommended as sound basic training for trainee work study officers. Valuable for showing to people whose work is likely to be the subject of work measurement.
